column2: but the Bucs have lost their last five night games in the regular season. That includes three this season and two last year. Sandwiched in between is last season’s playoff victory at night against the Eagles. There’s something about the Bucs with Todd Bowles and night games. There was no winning record in prime time with Tom Brady at quarterback in 2022
column3: either. Joe brings this up because the Bucs play tomorrow — at night. The Sunday Night Football affair at Dallas is not a must-win game
column4: but it certainly is critical. If the Bucs win out — at Dallas (6-8) and home for Carolina (3-11) and New Orleans (5-9) — then they’ll lock up the No. 3 seed in the NFC playoffs with a record of 11-6. A hiccup along the way and a lot could change. Joe hopes and expects that Bowles will try to tweak something tomorrow as it relates to game preparation. It’s hard to believe Tampa Bay’s woes at night are only tied to bad luck a higher-caliber of opponent. Coincidences are rare in the NFL. So Joe takes a little comfort in the Bucs being 5-2 on the road this season with both losses coming in overtime — each at night. Ira Kaufman Talks Tampa Bay’s Next Move With Liam Coen
